channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken litter bin in Broxbourne Gardens, Orpington, BR6, 24th August
item.description:
As well as the still overflowing dog waste bin at the bottom of Broxbourne Gardens, Orpington, BR6, which has already been reported, the litter bin at the top of the Gardens has been knocked off its post and is lying some distance away - see attached photo.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sequoia Gardens, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street is filthy with dog fouling, litter, dead rodents & over grown weeds, 24th August
item.description:
The street is filthy dirty & needs a deep clean (I have never seen any street cleaners in this street). Dog poo everywhere, dead mice in footpath, litter everywhere and over grown weeds, it’s disgusting. When are Hackney council going to clean the street?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Carysfort Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: These bushes have grown wild and always need at least an annual trim right along the road, 24th August
item.description:
These bushes along Park Mead need an annual trim without fail but as usual the council prioritise other things like removing flags. These bushes need cutting back about a foot past the curb along the whole road but this section is exceptionally worse

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Mead, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Valdalised Zebra Crossing, 24th August
item.description:
Graffiti on zebra crossing makes each white strip look like an English flag. I believe this is related to the recent protests and sends a message or intolerance and hatred. I noticed it today (24th august) but may have been there a while.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 387, Hurst Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please Hackney Council cleaner talks very loud on his phone all day doing no work in the block so a state why do we pay our service charges for these lazy and competent staff members. This cleaner also for a number of years has been locking himself in communal/maintenance cupboards skiving off work.behaviour needs to be dealt with, 24th August
item.description:

item.title: Black bag and strange goods spill out, 24th August
item.description:
